title: Why has my ping increased over the last 6 months?
body:
I live in Nebraska.

When you guys transferred the servers over to Illinois. My ping went from an avg of 200+ down to 10-14, and 20 on a "bad" day.

Now, 6 months later, My ping  bounces around 80-100.  But if I drive 8 hours up yonder to Chicago, I get 2 ping. Not 20 ping. Not 200 ping. 2 ping. 

Why am I getting the same level of ping 8 hours away as people that are a whole half country away from the server, when I originally was not? I had 10 ping for half the season, and now my ping is damn near identical to what it was with constant 150+ lag spikes like it was when the server was in California.

I don't understand it, and it's frankly annoying. I thought I was done with the erratic ping that randomly on a flip of a coin decides that you need to die due to a sudden ping jump, and the relatively high ping that makes the majority of champions frankly unplayable at a higher level. 

But that's neither here nor there. 

I just want to know why my ping was set to be 10-20, and it was for months, and then upped and skyrocketed back to 100 because reasons. Even though if I drive 8 hours north I get almost nonexistent ping.  Why is that?

replies.body: [Utilise Riot’s Log Reader to see what’s happening with your network.]( https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader)
That honestly didn't tell me anything related as to why my ping is now no longer 10-12.

Your increase in ping is likely due to your network, ISP or routing to the servers. By utilizing the log reader, you will be able to see what's happening with your network and the log reader will also provide you with possible solutions.

All it did was show my ping at exactly where I said it's at, and that's it. 

As far as I'm aware, Nebraska is supposed to have below 40 ping.

http://imgur.com/a/AKmzA

What it started as.

http://imgur.com/a/p6UJR

What it grew as. It literally increased by 30 on avg for no reason.

Now it sits

http://imgur.com/a/wjKk3

for the last 3 months.


But even on the very very very good days, it never goes below 60.  Even though in April  10 ping was the norm, and 19 was high. Now 60 ping is the "good ping." But on an average day, it's 90+ sometimes 300+ for hours straight. 

I've pretty much had new wires put in, had the guys over non stop, and literally nothing gets it any lower. Even had 7 new modems already.

Since you're still having issues after working through our connection guide, we'll need to take a deeper look at how your connection travels to the servers in order to pinpoint the cause of your latency rise. 

As *Rineyy* mentioned, the biggest factors that change your latency to a server are network infrastructure or ISP routing. You'll want to run a set of [traceroutes](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) and a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs), then attach them with a [ticket submission](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to our tech team.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Alright, I spose I'll do that when I get back from field training.

Though just to be certain, Nebraska is supposed to be sitting at like 10-20 ping, correct? That's what it was all the way into April for me. 

It didn't just up and revert back to 60-100+?

I'm not able to state for certain what specific latency numbers should be seen in specific geolocations. There are so many factors that go into what your latency will end up, latency can even be different for two houses that are next to each other but are on different ISP's.
